meanings.definition: a code of silence practiced by the Mafia
meanings.sent1: The mob boss enforced omerta among his men to keep their illegal activities hidden.
meanings.sent2: The members of the Mafia followed the omerta strictly to avoid any leaks to the authorities.
meanings.sent3: When asked about the stolen goods, Tony put on his best omerta face and stayed silent.
meanings.sent4: The omerta of the criminal underworld was like an invisible shield protecting its members.
meanings.sent5: The omerta was so ingrained in their culture that speaking out was unthinkable.

meanings.definition: a vow of silence or secrecy
meanings.sent1: After taking the omerta, she refused to disclose any information about the incident.
meanings.sent2: The group of friends made an omerta pact to never reveal each other's secrets.
meanings.sent3: Sarah jokingly declared an omerta on her surprise birthday party plans.
meanings.sent4: The omerta they shared was like a lock on the box of their hidden truths.
meanings.sent5: Their omerta was so strong that even under pressure, they didn't utter a word.
